metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9776 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow leading to Heap buffer overflow in JBIG2Stream.cc inpdftocairo in Poppler before 0.56 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impactvia a crafted PDF document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9776` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: poppler package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.4').
